CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Config.​Targets.​InputBase
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Config.​Targets.​SourceFolder

A base class for the configuration of all input targets.

Functions

public InputBase (
PropertyLocation propertyLocation,
Files.InputType type

abstract public InputBase Duplicate ()

abstract public void GenerateDefaultName ()
IsSameTarget
public abstract bool IsSameTarget (
InputBase other
)

Override to determine whether the two input targets are fundamentally the same.  Only primary identifying properties should be compared, so two SourceFolders should return true if they point to the same folder, and secondary properties such as Name and Number should be ignored.

Properties
Name
public string Name { get; set }

The name of the input target, or null if it isn't defined.  Names are used to distinguish multiple file sources in user-visible places such as menus.  They should ideally be unique.

Number
public int Number { get; set }

The number of the input target, or zero if it isn't defined.  Numbers are used to distinguish multiple file sources in URLs, such as File:​Folder​/Source​.cs versus File2:Folder/Source.cs, and must be unique for each Type.

Type
public Files.InputType Type { get; set }

The type of file source this input target provides.

Property Locations
NamePropertyLocation
public PropertyLocation NamePropertyLocation { get; set }

Where Name is defined, or Source.NotDefined if it isn't.

NumberPropertyLocation
public PropertyLocation NumberPropertyLocation { get; set }

Where Number is defined, or Source.NotDefined if it isn't.

TypePropertyLocation
public PropertyLocation TypePropertyLocation { get; set }

Where Type is defined, or Source.NotDefined if it isn't.
